item.title: Overgrown path, 9th August
item.description:
The path was cleared earlier in the year, taking two men two days. It has since been left to grow over the path again. When the weather turns this will again turn into a quagmire.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Sedgewick Gardens, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 9th August
item.description:
*** Police Ref: 519 08/08/2025 *** Police advised last night they witnessed someone trying to rip off a street nameplate sign & its now been left unsecure with the metal hinges damaged & not on correctly. The street nameplate sign is for 'Market Street leading to Gt Western Road Park Street' & is a Black & White.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)

item.title: Blocked drains, 8th August
item.description:
The lovely new perforated kerbs are blocked with silt and weeds growing in them. These and all roads on the area have not had their gutters and drains cleaned for three years or more. Donâ€™t we clean roads anymore? The accumulation of dead leaves and road detritus is a disgrace. The slightest amount of rain makes the roads awash. Danger to motorists in general and motorcycles in particular.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.description:
The Pavement on the Allotment side of Alma Rd Blue markings have been added in the last couple of days. there are two boxes marked 'EVCP' Does anyone know why these have been done?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Alma Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Blocked & Foul Smelling Kerb Gulley, 8th August
item.description:
The kerb gully outside No27 stinks all year round. Some days worse than others but stinks 90% of the time. The smell is sewer smell and affects the immediate vicinity. We asked Severn Trent to take a look and they confirmed it is Highways responsibility and suggested that it is silted up or broken. It should not smell of sewer. I raised this issue to highways 2 weeks ago and it was closed with no action by Highways and no communication. The gully has not been maintained in the 23 years that we have lived here. We would really appreciate some help to resolve this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Moorend Crescent, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
